title.narrative: Assessment of soil amendment rock resources and balanced application of fertilizer and soil conditioners in Ethiopia

description.narrative: The project aims to increase the potential in Ethiopia related to phosphate resources developing of soil conditioners and technical know-how for balanced usage of fertilizers and conditioners. Improved food production needs increased use of fertilizers and balancing of the generally too acidic soil. The overall objective is improved productivity of agricultural land and improved food security. The project is implemented by Geological Survey of Finland (GTK) in cooperation with Geological survey of Ethiopia and the Ministry of Agriculture of Ethiopia. MTT Agrifood Research Finland supports the project.The project has the following components:- Assessment of rock resources suitable for acidic soil amendment: The huge resources of carbonates in Ethiopia are mai nly being used in the cement industry, this project evaluates some of these resources for soil amendment/agricultural uses. - Balanced application of lime and fertilizers: The project conducts a soil survey in one or two selected pilot areas and determines proper proportions of fertilizers and conditioner which can be recommended for local farmers. This can be partly supported by literature studies.- Related capacity building programs: including upgrading of respective laboratories at GSE/MoM and MoA, train ing in sustainable exploitation of raw materials, building capacity and methodology in soil and rock analysis, laboratory management and selected equipments.- Disseminating informationThe expected results of the project are: 1) Increasing knowledge on exis ting raw material (rock) soil P-fertilizer and human resources expertise technical facilities and stakeholders and finalized project implementation plan 2) Improved technical and human capacities on mapping and documenting geoinformation of suitable soil a mending resources 3) Improved knowledge on balanced usage of P- fertilizers and conditioners that can increase agricultural productivity 4) Improved advisory system from soil surveys to farmers for balanced use of P- fertilizer and soil conditioners 5) Doc umenting and disseminating lessons learnt and best practices and future cooperation plan.Project budget for 2014-2015 is 625058 euros of which applied ICI funding is 500000 euros.
